The objective evaluation PFM strength assess use portable perineometer . All parameter perform one moment G1 , G2 , 20th 36th week pregnancy , 45 day delivery . Pregnancy vaginal delivery may cause weakness PFM .
DOC.brief_title: Pelvic Floor Muscle Function Nulliparous Primiparous .
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : This study aim compare pelvic floor muscle ( PFM ) strength nulliparous primiparous woman . Populations : The sample size establish consider significance level 5 % , test power 80 % , estimate error 10 % . According result consider range percentage answer casual error , group establish approximately 50 participant . Methods : 100 woman prospectively distribute : Group G1 ( n = 50 ) comprise healthy nulliparous woman ; Group G2 ( n = 50 ) primiparous one . Subjective evaluation PFM strength perform use transvaginal digital palpation ( TDP ) . The objective evaluation PFM strength assess use portable perineometer . All parameter perform one moment G1 , G2 , 20th 36th week pregnancy , 45 day delivery . Results : In G2 , 14 woman exclude due lose follow-up . The median age 23 year G1 22 , G2 , statistical difference group . In G1 , BMI average 21.7 Kg/m2 , 25,0 Kg/m2 G2 , statistical difference group ( p= 0.0004 ) . In G2 , TDP evaluation show significant impairment PFM strength 36th week pregnancy ( p=0,0006 ) 45 day vaginal delivery ( p=0.0001 ) compare nulliparous . Objective evaluation PFM strength show significant decrease 45 day vaginal delivery compare nullipara . Conclusion : Pregnancy vaginal delivery may cause weakness PFM .
DOC.criteria: Nulliparous primiparous G1 ( nulliparous ) UI , neurological disease , previous pelvic surgery , diabetes , smoke cognitive difficulty . In G2 ( primipara ) , criterion use include woman gestational complication diabetes , hypertension , vaginal urinary infection .
